steps.description: Barclays detects unusual account activity and sends a fraud alert to the customer via push notification, SMS, or email.
steps.businessRationale: Fraud alerts must be delivered within minutes to minimize financial loss and prevent further unauthorized activity.

steps.description: Customer reviews the suspicious activity and confirms whether the transaction was legitimate or fraudulent.
steps.businessRationale: Customers typically take 3–5 minutes to review and respond to fraud alerts. Faster responses reduce exposure to additional fraudulent transactions.

steps.description: Customer completes identity verification to confirm account ownership using biometrics, OTP, or security questions.
steps.businessRationale: Identity verification is essential to prevent account takeover. Banks target 4–6 minutes for secure verification.

steps.description: Barclays temporarily freezes the account, blocks compromised cards, and prevents further transactions.
steps.businessRationale: Lockdown must be fast to minimize financial loss. UK banks typically complete this in under 5 minutes.

steps.description: Customer resets credentials, updates security settings, and restores safe access to their account.
steps.businessRationale: Account recovery flows typically take 5–8 minutes. A smooth process reduces churn and improves trust.

steps.description: Barclays restores account functionality, issues new cards if needed, and activates enhanced monitoring.
steps.businessRationale: Restoration and monitoring setup typically takes 3–5 minutes. This step is critical for customer reassurance and retention.
